Trial_Design.evidence: Seventeen epilepsy patients participated in an ECoG motor mapping experiment at a single center.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility included patients undergoing presurgical evaluation.

Intervention.evidence: This study aims to validate ECoG for presurgical mapping by comparing it with direct electrical cortical stimulation (ECS) and functional MRI (fMRI).

Objective.evidence: This study aims to validate ECoG for presurgical mapping by comparing it with direct electrical cortical stimulation (ECS) and functional MRI (fMRI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: High gamma activity was modeled using the general linear model (GLM), and regions with significant gamma power increase were localized.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventeen epilepsy patients participated in an ECoG motor mapping experiment at a single center.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ECoG had higher sensitivity than fMRI (66.7% vs. 52.6%, p < 0.05) with high specificity for both (>97%).
